page.title: 10NOTABLE LOCAL EVENTS
page.content: CONSIDERABLE LOACAL FEELING HAS BEEN RAISED OVER PLANS TO ALTER THE PATTERN OF ROADS ACROSS THE FAMOUS GREEN IN GREAT BENTLEY. NUMEROUS ACCIDENTS HACE OCCURED AT THE CROSS-ROADS AT THE CENTRE OF THE GREEN AND NOW ONE OF THE ROADS HAS BEEN CLOSED, MAKING A TEE JUNCTION. PART OF THE GREEN IS TO BE USED TO MAKE A NEW ROAD AND THE MAJORITY OF LOCAL PEOPLE WOULD APPEAR TO OPPOSE THIS . THE BUIL;DING OF A NEW DUAL CARRIAGEWAY CONNECTING CLACTON AND COLCHESTER HAS INCREASED TRAFFIC THROUGH THE VILLAGE WHICH HAS AGGRAVATED THE PROBLEM. FIVE NEW HOUSES HAVE BEEN BUILT, WITH PLANS FOR TEN MORE. THIS IS THE LARGEST NUMBER OF HOUSES BUILT IN THE VILLAGE FOR THE LAST TWENTY YEARS. PLANS ARE ALSO WELL ADVANCED FOR A NEW VILLAGE HALL/COMMUNITY CENTRE WHICH HAS CAUSED GREAT EXCITEMENT.
